text: Bassett is a city in Allen County, Kansas, United States. It is situated along the Neosho River. In 2020, 20 people lived there. ==History== Bassett was created in 1903. The next year, the Bassett and Concreto extensions were made to the Iola Electric Railroad street car line. In 1914, the first concrete road in Kansas was created in Bassett. ==Geography== Bassett is at (37.904017, -95.408005). The city is east of the Neosho River along the south bank of Elm Creek in Iola Township. It is next to the southern border of the city of Iola (the county seat). Lake Bassola is east of the city. The city is less than two miles southwest of the interchange between U.S. Routes 54 and 169. The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . Of that, is land and is water. ===Weather=== Bassett has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Bassett has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Bassett, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 20 people living in Bassett. There were 5 households. The median age was 49.5 years. Of the people, 75.0% were White, and 25.0% were two or more races. None were Hispanic or Latino. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 14 people, 5 households, and 4 families living in Bassett. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Bassett - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 257, local school district ;Maps * Bassett City Map , KDOT Category:20th-century establishments in Kansas Category:Cities in Allen County, Kansas Category:1903 establishments in the United States
title: Bassett, Kansas
